alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Rutland County through 815 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Poultney, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Castleton, Poultney Village, Tinmouth, Rutland City, Middletown Springs, Wallingford, Lake St. Catherine, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Poultney, Fair Haven, Clarendon, West Rutland, Ira, Mendon, Proctor, Wells, Shrewsbury, West Haven and East Clarendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
